Scene 2 : Wouldn't You Prefer a Good Game of Chess?

Now that they know where the Soviet Encampment is, the Players are free to return to the lab. Salvaging tools, they work on decoding what they saw in the Observatory.

After many hours of codebreaking, they learn a horrible truth.

The blinking object they noticed through the telescope1 was sending coordinates. Plotting them, they realize that although the coordinates are very imprecise,2 they roughly correlate to the capitals of every major country in the world.

  1. Also known as Sputnik. ↩

  2. They don’t need to be, as the rockets will rely on Organic Control. ↩

A Lovecraftian horror story, written for the Trail of Cthulhu Game System.
